Keir Starmer , Director of Public Prosecutions, said the Crown Prosecution Service( CPS) would conduct a ''comprehensive assessment'' of evidence collected by detectives. The purpose of this assessment is to ascertain whether there is any material which could now form evidence in any future criminal prosecution relating to phone hacking, the CPS said in a statement. interview excerpt from '' Colin Powell , President Bush 's first secretary of state, ''did not, in my view, do a good job of managing the people under him,'' Donald Rumsfeld said.'' There was a lot of leaking out of the State Department, and the president knew it, he said. ''And it was unhelpful. And most of it ended up making the State Department look good. We didn't do that in the Pentagon. I insisted we not do it.''
